unnormalised: Hey folks, wanna talk trash? Literally! Waste management in India is getting a much-needed makeover.
normalised: Hey folks, wanna talk trash? Literally! Waste management in India is getting a much needed makeover.

unnormalised: Remember the piles of garbage near the sets of "Gully Boy" in Mumbai? Well, things are slowly changing, at least according to the latest report from IIT Delhi. They've been researching new composting techniques and are showing some real promise.
normalised: Remember the piles of garbage near the sets of "Gully Boy" in Mumbai? Well, things are slowly changing, at least according to the latest report from I I T Delhi. They've been researching new composting techniques and are showing some real promise.

unnormalised: Apparently, some municipalities are even piloting systems where they incentivize segregation at the source – think discounts on your property tax, like a Rs. 500 rebate for households in Indore who properly separate their waste.
normalised: Apparently, some municipalities are even piloting systems where they incentivize segregation at the source – think discounts on your property tax, like a rupee five hundred rebate for households in Indore who properly separate their waste.

unnormalised: The big challenge, of course, is scale. Replicating these successes across a country as vast as ours, covering thousands of kilometers, is a massive undertaking. And let's not forget the informal waste pickers, often overlooked but crucial to the entire system. Their livelihoods need to be factored in!
